title: 'Heading ball likely contributed to McQueen's brain disease'
summary: An inquest concludes that "it is likely that repetitive head impacts, sustained by heading the ball while playing football, contributed to the CTE" which was a factor in the former footballer's death.

title: 'Heading ball likely contributed to McQueen's brain disease'
summary: An inquest concludes that "it is likely that repetitive head impacts, sustained by heading the ball while playing football, contributed to the CTE" which was a factor in the former footballer's death.

title: Pegula ends Keys title defence to win 'gross' apple pie bet
summary: Jessica Pegula ends Madison Keys' Australian Open title defence to reach the quarter-finals and win a "gross" apple pie bet.

title: Pato consortium interested in Colchester takeover
summary: Former AC Milan and Brazil forward Alexandre Pato is a member of a consortium interested in taking over Colchester United.

title: Pato consortium interested in Colchester takeover
summary: Former AC Milan and Brazil forward Alexandre Pato is a member of a consortium interested in taking over Colchester United.

title: Scotland to face Ivory Coast at Everton's stadium
summary: Steve Clarke's Scotland will face Ivory Coast for the first time at Everton's Hill Dickinson Stadium on 31 March as part of their World Cup preparations.

title: Jeffries and Pendry complete 53-strong GB Winter Olympics squad
summary: Team GB will send a 53-member team to the Winter Olympics after biathletes Jacques Jeffries and and Shawna Pendry became the final members of the squad.

title: McLaren and Red Bull unveil 2026 cars as testing starts

summary: Ireland hammer Namibia by eight wickets to win their final Twenty20 Women's World Cup qualifying group match in Kathmandu.

summary: Matt Weston says the turnaround in the GB skeleton team has been "absolutely insane" as he goes into the Winter Olympics favourite to win gold.

summary: Match of The Day pundit Wayne Rooney speaks about Michael Carrick's long-term future at Manchester United after his side's 3-2 win against Arsenal.

title: Why did Alcaraz, Sinner and Sabalenka have to remove fitness trackers?
summary: Carlos Alcaraz was told he could not wear a fitness tracker at the Australian Open. BBC Sport analyses why - and what it means for player welfare.

title: Northern Ireland's Harper wins iconic Daytona 24 Hours
summary: Northern Ireland's Dan Harper has won the iconic Daytona 24 Hour race with BMW after battling fog and winning from the back of the grid.

title: Scotland progress in Women's T20 World Cup qualifiers
summary: Scotland proceed to the Women's T20 World Cup qualifier Super 6 stage with a fourth group win out of five after defeating hosts Nepal by 72 runs.

title: Woods comparisons continue after Scheffler wins again
summary: World number one Scottie Scheffler becomes the second-fastest player to win 20 PGA Tour events with a four-shot victory at the American Express in California.

title: Warriors win 'bizarre, sad' game in Minnesota after ICE shooting
summary: Steve Kerr says the Golden State Warriors' win at the Minnesota Timberwolves took place in a "sombre atmosphere" after the fatal shooting of an intensive care nurse by immigration agents in Minneapolis.

title: Martinez edging closer to Villa career crossroads
summary: Emiliano Martinez is hailed as the world's best goalkeeper at Aston Villa home games - but even though his team are riding high, the Argentina international is at a crossroads.

title: F1 testing begins - but why all the secrecy?
summary: BBC F1 correspondent Andrew Benson looks ahead to the first F1 test of 2026, which is happening in private in Barcelona.

title: Man Utd have taken step towards winning formula - Rooney
summary: Manchester United have taken a "step" towards getting back to where they were during their glory days, says Wayne Rooney.

title: How family grief made Hamer-Webb pick Wales over England
summary: Uncapped Gabriel Hamer-Webb reveals how his Cardiff-born mother urged him to pick Wales over England for his international future.

title: Seahawks to face Patriots in Super Bowl 60
summary: The Seattle Seahawks will face the New England Patriots in Super Bowl 60 after claiming a thrilling victory over the Los Angeles Rams on Sunday.

summary: Match of The Day pundit Danny Murphy praises Aston Villa's front four for their "well-coached" play that broke down Newcastle.

summary: MOTD pundit Danny Murphy explains how Manchester United earned their impressive win at Premier League leaders Arsenal, and how he feels the Gunners will react.

title: GB's Muir secures X Games slopestyle gold
summary: Britain's Kirsty Muir lays down a marker before the Winter Olympics with slopestyle gold at the X Games in Aspen.

title: Hardly anyone would have picked Carrick to be Man Utd boss - but now?
summary: As Michael Carrick's perfect start at Manchester United continues, is he building a case for the job longer term?

title: Liverpool's Robertson unlikely to move to Spurs
summary: Liverpool left-back Andy Robertson looks set to remain at Anfield after the Reds decide they are currently unable to proceed with a deal to sell him to Tottenham.

title: Why Arsenal's wobble may not even matter - despite 'feeling pressure'
summary: Arsenal's winless run may normally be cause for concern - but the stats suggest they are still in control of the Premier League title race.

title: Totally unrealistic to win every game - Arteta

summary: Newcastle United have yet to win a league game without Bruno Guimaraes since he made his debut for the club in 2022.
